citation.article-title: Nocardia beijingensis sp. nov., a novel isolate from soil.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Nocardia beijingensis sp. nov.
Nocardia beijingensis (bei.jing.en'sis. N.L. masc. adj. beijingensis pertaining to Beijing, the source of the isolate)
Aerobic, Gram-positive, catalase-positive, slightly acid-alcohol-fast, non-motile actinomycete that produces an orange substrate mycelium that fragments in situ into irregular rod-shaped elements.
Short chains of up to four conidia are formed on substrate and aerial hyphae.
Colony elevation is convex to irregular and colony margins are filamentous.
Nitrate is reduced and aesculin and urea are hydrolysed.
Uric acid is degraded but not adenine, casein, elastin, hypoxanthine, tyrosine or xanthine.

The organism grows at between 18 and 35 °C and on D(-)-arabinose, D(+­)-cellobiose, dulcitol (weak), meso-erythritol, ethanol, D(-)-fucose (weak), D(-)-fructose, D(­+)-galactose, glycerol, glycogen, D(­+)-glucose, inulin, D(+­)-lactose, D(+­)-maltose, D(­+)-mannose, D(­+)-raffinose, α-L-rhamnose, D(-)-ribose, salicin, D(­+)-sucrose, D(­+)-trehalose, D(+­)-xylose (all at 1%, w/v), acetate, benzoate, fumarate, gluconate, p-hydroxybenzoic acid, H-malate, pyruvate and succinate (at 0.1%, w/v) as sole carbon sources for energy and growth but not on adonitol, arbutin, meso-inositol, D(+­)-melezitose, D(+­)-melibiose, amethyl D-glucoside, xylitol, isoamyl alcohol, isobutanol, n-propanol (1%, w/v or v/v), butyrate or m-hydroxybenzoic acid (0.1%, w/v).

L-Alanine (weak), L-aspartate, L-glutamate, monoethanolamine, L-proline, uric acid and L-valine are used as sole carbon and nitrogen sources but not acetamide, gelatin, L-leucine, phenylalanine or urea (all at 0.1%, w/v).
The G­C content of the DNA is 69 mol%.
The organism was isolated from a mud sample taken from a sewage ditch at Xishan mountain in Beijing.
The type strain is strain 02T [=AS4.1521T (China Culture Collection of Microorganisms, Beijing) =IFO 16342T=JCM 10666T].
The species description is based on a single strain and hence serves as the type strain description.
